Reviews.Title: “great trip and great staff”
Reviews.Author: jephyboy
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was excellent. I was originally booked for a king room, but was upgraded to a double queen room with loft. I couldn't ask for anything better for the price that I paid. The room contained a microwave, small fridge, and had 2 TV's. It was very clean and tastefully appointed. Housekeeping was daily and they did a very good job. I had some friends stay in another room and they mentioned that the street noise was a bit distracting for their sleeping. While I didn't have that problem, I could definitely see what they were talking about. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and had the standard Holiday Inn selection: egg, sausage/bacon, biscuit, gravy, toast, cereal, milk, juice, and pancakes. The seating area was not very plentiful, so several people has to take their plates back to the room. Onsite parking is valet only . . . $15/night. There is a small neighborhood with free street parking, but wasn't sure if it was safe to park overnight. Some great restaurants and shopping about a 10-minute walk away at the mall. The street where the hotel is located is extremely busy, so be careful walking around. If you have to be in the area and can't afford the higher priced hotels nearby (intercontinental, hyatt, etc), this is a great alternative at a very competitive price. Bottom line: Good hotel for the price watchers if you must stay in this immediate area. Ask for a room away from the busy and potentially loud Olympic Blvd side of the hotel. If you are driving, be prepared to pay for valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SelbyBrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to my niece's apartment. It was also convenient being across from Ralph's grocery store and the Century City mall. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and I would especially like to commend Bryan at the front desk and Lorenzo, the garage valet. No matter what hour of the day, Lorenzo seemed to be in the garage all the time! Our room was on the street side and was noisy so try to ask for a room on the other side of the building. Otherwise, the rooms were adequate for the 3 of us. The breakfast was good and my husband especially liked the cinnamon rolls. Being a Priority Club member is nice because of the goodie bag you get. I would stay here again when visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MLBateson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Century City for a few days over Easter and were very pleased. The location is dead handy, the rooms are very large and clean, and the staff are so helpful. I left a bag of shopping in the lobby before catching a taxi to the airport, and the guy behind the desk picked it up for me and is holding on to it so my brother can pick it up this weekend. The only downside was the lack of healthy options at breakfast, and that the street side can be a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Leena K
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an excellent location, free internet and breakfast included in the price. My room was spacious, clean and quiet and equipped with a huge TV. The hotel staff was very helpful and minor problem with internet connection was promptly fixed. I stayed in Los Angeles to attend a conference. My impression was that I had a much better hotel for almost half the price than my collegues who stayed at the conference hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Stefani L
Reviews.Content: Everything was lovely except there need to be safety strips on the exit ledge from the shower. I have the bruises to show for a very bad crash onto the marble floor. You might also ask for a room away from the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamish C
Reviews.Content: A good hotel that is close to Century City Mall . Many thanks to Troy on the front desk for getting us into a nice Quiet room (with the loft in in it ) after our familys long flight from Australia .Also the to lady in the breakfast area for cleaning up after my son who had not quite recovered from that long flight .

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, rooms, & free breakfast & wifi...”
Reviews.Author: johnsonhor
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, they still have coffee pots (some places don't anymore - but they still do). My room had two floors which was cool. The room has all the toiletries as well as different types of pillows - firm to soft. A full breakfast (not the continental type) - sausage, eggs, cereal, pancakes, coffee, juice, milk, hot cereals, etc.. Great value for the price. Plus there's a Ralph's across the Street too...

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean place to stay with valet parking”
Reviews.Author: Chip S
Reviews.Content: Troy, at the front desk was extremely helpful, friendly and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for doing LA stuff”
Reviews.Author: dorso53
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for our needs. We were on spring break with 2 teenagers and were able to go to all the places we wanted to see without driving long distances. The hotel has been remodeled and our room was really nice. We had a 2 queen loft which put the teens upstairs with their own space and TV. Free breakfast daily and very helpful, friendly staff. The hotel manager, Mr. Rana, was especially helpful. When we had an issue with Super Shuttle pick up for our return to airport, the manager set us up with a town car that was very reasonable. Overall, a great reasonably priced place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, helpful”
Reviews.Author: B E
Reviews.Content: My relatives from out of town recently visited LA and stayed at the Holiday Inn Exp Century City. They enjoyed their stay and found the hotel to be a great value! Hotels in the area can be expensive and I am so happy to be able to recommend this reasonably priced, clean and conveniently located hotel to anyone who visits me in the future. I met up with them at the hotel a few times during their stay and every time the front desk staff and valet where friendly. Bryan at the front desk was especially helpful answering questions my relatives had about the area, making recommendations and looking up directions to the restaurant. Thank you for taking care of my fam!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sac_joy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend on a trip to visit the Getty Museum and other fun things around the area. The HIE Century City is a great location--close to the 405, Santa Monica Pier, Beverly Hills and Hollywood--and the neighborhood feels safe and clean. We got a double queen room on the quiet side-street, and had no problems with noise. The room was a little eccentric, with steps leading up into it, but it was very clean and the beds and pillows were comfortable. The breakfast was fine-cereal, pancakes, fruit, etc. Best of all was the staff. Troy, as mentioned in prior reviews, was stellar: super-friendly, greeted us by name, informative about the area, and the valet parking situation was really nice (I don't think anyone has mentioned this. It's $15/night, and worth every penny). Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kajunspice
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property a few times now and have come to enjoy the hospitality I receive upon each arrival and during my stays. Troy has been extremely helpful and goes out of his way to make your stay the best possible. The staff from top to bottom are first-rate. The location is great if you are doing business between Santa Monica and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: M R
Reviews.Content: Ask to stay in a duplex room. They're full of sun, quiet in the evening, clean and very comfortable. Beds are terrific, pillows are fabulous. The staff was very helpful. While it's not a typical glitz LA hotel, if you're going on business the location in Century City is perfect. Parking there is extremely affordable as well. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 197Rob
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business. All you need. Includes breafast. Hospitality was Superb. Troy at the front desk is the man!

Reviews.Title: “Great option!”
Reviews.Author: Sergio N
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. Breakfast was very good and Wifi was fast. Troy at the Front Desk was very helpful and made the difference. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called a motel”
Reviews.Author: Hernandezmm
Reviews.Content: Does not rise to a hotel category/standard. Rooms are tiny, cheap furnishings. Some of the staff are great though.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: mlipshin
Reviews.Content: My son and I flew into LA from Chicago for a 24 stay. He had an interview at UCLA for his residency and I came with to visit family. The last thing my son wanted to do was share a room with his mom. Rather than reserving 2 rooms, I made a reservation for a room with 2 separate beds. Instead, the hotel gave us a room that had a spiral staircase with one bed upstairs and the other downstairs. It was a suite. I even got a welcome goody bag. I was blown away. The staff was so accommodating, from the valet, to Sohaib, to Troy at the front desk answering all my questions, giving directions and relocating my lost boarding passes. Every member of their staff was kind, considerate and helpful. The location: great. Breakfast and coffee: great. Staff: great. Room: outstanding. Thank you again for the superior accommodations. You really make your guests feel important.

Reviews.Title: “Special touches, great staff and convenience of Century City Shopping Ctr”
Reviews.Author: drtravelbug2
Reviews.Content: We stayed a nite here in Sept 2011, stopping over in LA before heading to Florida. I picked the location due to the nearby Century City shopping ctr and this hotel is not too far from LAX. I figured we could recover from jetlag and stock up instead of wasting time shopping during the early days of our stay at Disney World ... at the time of booking, I had not realized the American airline policy of charging per bag or limiting wt allowance per bag. The hotel is small but staff are v receptive and helpful. Troy kindly upgraded our room to one with a loft which our greenhorn Ozzie kids got a big kick out of. We did not know about gym passes as welcome gifts for Priority Club members at many Hol Inn locations we have freq but our Hol Inn visits overseas have often offered upgrades without my asking for it, when they are available, dep on how busy they are. There were no noise hassles as we were allocated a room on the top floor away from the noisy side ( a tip from another TA reviewer earlier). The Mexican lady (named Gloria, I think) deserves a pat on her back for being so accomodating cuz we were travelling with our 3 kids, the youngest sleeping in, past the opening hrs of the dining rm. Breakie is complimentary and reasonable, with warm waffles, cereals, meat patties, pancakes, omelettes, individual cartons of milk, coffee/tea etc. It ain't Mariott or Westin but this joint has its own personal touches that make this an amiable warm place to stay ... like the chain's signature cinnamon rolls, little pcs of chocs near the elevator, Wi-Fi and printer facilities in the lobby, The service from the staff is the icing on its cake. Cannot recall all the staff names now but the other 3 were ace too. There is no restaurant at this hotel but who needs that when Century City is just a stone's throw away? Check out www.westfield.com/centurycity - website will advise you on shops there which include Macy's, Bloomingdale's and cinemas. There is a Gelson's supermart with friendly staff. There is also a Wolfgang Puck Express within Gelson's so U don't have to wait to get to Disney. There are a few restaurants as well as a food court but we found the food at Sorabol disappointing wrt its supposedly Korean flavour. Forget about getting voltage converters there for American use. Macy sell converters for Americans to use overseas. I brought along my Smart phone. The Apple and computer shops could not meet my needs and I found a stall outside Macy's which sold me a SIM card for 1 month's capped internet and overseas/local call access for $110 (without the phone) - I felt ripped off but the convenience and a cab to another provider would have cost me more. Go to the Concierge desk with proof that you are not a local from LA and it will give ya a visitor's card offering discounts or freebies. True that we could not walk to anywhere else of interest without developing plantar fascitis or cramps but the staff helped us call a cab for about US$15 that took us to a place that had both Marshall and Ross as well as food at Johnny Rockets/Baja. Near the vending machine, I found bklets of menus of a multitude of restaurants providing food deiiveries .....wild.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DenMag
Reviews.Content: The staff are considerate and helpful, always there to answer a question or fulfill a need. Specifically, Christian was awesome... he helped me out with every question I had, including about the hotel, about the area, where to eat, where to shop, how to get to my venue. He was fabulous. The hotel is clean. The rooms are spacious (I had 2 doubles). The bathrooms look great. Was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jcrollo
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here for an interview for UCLA and the management, Christian really helped me out he gave me great directions and told me about the area. The room is great and I couldn't be happier. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, relatively big rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: g_t_b_right
Reviews.Content: Does a great job for the league it plays in - Location: About a 5-10 minute walk to Century City mall, big grocery store across the street Rooms: Pleasant decor, quite large for a hotel of this class and TV / channels were great Staff: Bryan and Troy were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very great staff”
Reviews.Author: zack n
Reviews.Content: Troy helps the extra mile when working. The location is in a part of town just out of the way enough of Century City Mall. There is a Ralph's across the street which comes in handy also. You can walk to it.

Reviews.Title: “What's with the Boss?”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: This Hol Inn Exp is tough to find; no signs visible...dwarfed by The Marriott next door. Let me say the Desk peeps were good, trying their best.......But there were several checking in at once....... The "Manager" was there chiding them rather than helping them....think his name was Paul. Seemed very impressed with himself but was overly patronizing to those checking in and demeaning to his staff........When he finally walked away (they were still busy) you could see the sighs of relief...... The Inn itself is a decent value but not the Beverly Wilshire, but this Paul thinks that's where he is......The pretentious attitude is not suited to The Express.....

Reviews.Title: “Just a little blah...”
Reviews.Author: W M
Reviews.Content: Let me first start off by saying I am incredibly picky with my hotels. So that being said, here we go: Check In/Front Desk: First, locating the hotel is difficult. There are no signs. It is right by a huge sign for the Courtyard by Marriot. So when you see that sign, you know you are in the right place. There is a $15 valet service. The valet guy was incredibly nice and I felt very secure with leaving my vehicle over night there. The front desk person, Troy, seemed very cold at first. He did not welcome me as a priority club member and I did not receive a gift at check in, which at other Holiday Inn Expresses seemed to be the norm. I later inquired about a fitness center and he offered a pass to a gym which was incredibly convenient! He was very helpful and cheery after my initial check in, which was good. There was also another person at the front desk when I checked in. I didn't get a name, but she was incredibly personable and even struck up a little conversation with me, which was welcoming and seemed like natural conversation, where as with other hotel front desk staff, it seems that they ask questions because they have to. The Room: There was a lot of noise from W. Olympic Blvd. in my room. Also I could hear every step being taken in the hallway outside and in the room above mine. I can generally sleep through the noise, but this was a little excessive. The room was clean, except the bath tub looks like it needs a good bleaching. Also, there was a small stain on one of my bed's comforters. One thing about the "Two Queen Non-Smoking" beds is that they are small. I sleep on a Queen bed at home, and these were definitely smaller, almost the size of a double bed. The beds are very very comfortable and the room was incredibly spacious. There was a microwave, mini-fridge, flat screen TV, iron and ironing board, small desk and chair. Location: Like I said, incredibly difficult to find. It is in a good area though. There is a grocery store nearby and a great mall with plenty of fine dining opportunities with in walking distance (about 5 blocks) Overall: I liked this hotel's staff and the room wasn't bad. If you decide to stay here, try and get a room away from Olympic Blvd!

Reviews.Title: “Century City”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Great staff, clean rooms/bathrooms. Nicest Holliday Inn Express I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Traffic in the week, no maintenance at the weekend”
Reviews.Author: BritBronco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights, the first 2 nights in a room on the 2nd floor, and then a loft suite on the 4th floor. The room on the 2nd floor suffered from a lot of traffic noise, it seemed like the cars drove right past the window. Make sure you get a room on a higher floor or one that isn’t on the Olympic Boulevard side of the building. The room on the 4th floor was really nice with lots of space; however the air conditioning didn’t work. I reported this to the front desk and was told someone would come the next day to fix it but nobody did. When I went back again they told me nobody could fix it until after the weekend. I was offered a change of room but I didn’t want to waste time packing up all my stuff when I could be out in L.A. Over the weekend our toilet also broke, again nobody could fix this until Monday, so we had to use the one on the 2nd floor for the rest of the stay. On check out the manager waived the parking cost for this room ($45), but it didn’t really make up for it. At least both rooms had excellent large flat screen televisions. The breakfast was good, but it’s served in a small room and it can get very crowded. The hotel is shaped like a wedge and the breakfast room is situation right at the pointy end. The location is good for day activities; it’s a sensible driving distance to Santa Monica, Hollywood, Universal and the Getty Centre, however it is long way from nightlife so if you want that I suggest somewhere closer to Hollywood. Overall I don’t think this location warranted the price and would definitely not return.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique size hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen K
Reviews.Content: Only 47 rooms makes it feel much more intimate. I told the desk clerk about a very tiny plumbing issue (it wasn't even an issue, really) - it was fixed within a couple of hours. Pleasant desk and valet service. Across the road from a good grocery store. Very tiny breakfast room didn't matter to me-I wasn't planning to hang out in the breakfast room. Quiet room, Excellent value. Clean everywhere. Embroidered pillowcases for firmness of pillows! That's a first for me.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Byron B
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for low key business traveler. It has everything you need.....clean and comfortable room, with a very good breakfast (hot or cold). The one exception is there is not an onsite workout room. They do provide a free pass to workout facility about a mile away. My opinion it is better to drive than walk. Front desk help is outstanding.....Troy in the morning and Brian at night. As of the date of this review there were no issue for my stay.... plan to stay for my entire busines trip of 8 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jimmmminy
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest holiday inn express around. It is nicer than most holiday inn regulars. Only drawback is its right on a really busy road and its pretty noisy in the room at night. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Henna1982
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business, and usually dont write reviews or give recommendations unless i really feel compelled to. This hotel is definitely a great place to stay, with clean rooms, nice and attentive staff, and a great breakfast. What really impressed me the most was the staff at this hotel. I was helped by a Belizean guy who got me into the room in a fast and very courteous manner, got me what i asked for without an attitude, and also gave me the best recommendation for dinner and shopping. I am very impressed by this hotel! It seems more like a boutique hotel with its personalized service instead of a chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lorane
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is beyond excellent! The breakfast bar was terrific. The value, compared to nearby hotels, was great. There were a couple problems with our room, however: The A/C unit was mounted high on the wall above the door to the bathroom, almost directly over one of the two queen beds. This created a chilling problem for the people sleeping in that bed. The bathroom door also hit the side of one of the beds and would not fully open. A king-size bed would be better for the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Grace F
Reviews.Content: I am staying currently at this hotel for a quilting convention. This was my first time to Californian and was lost in the big city. I was greeted by the most kind, respectful and courteous gentleman Bryan who welcomed me graciously as I was shell shocked being in the big city for the first time. Everything was what I expected and more! Once friends arrived we all wanted to see what all California had to offer. We all wound up going to out and having a wonderful evening all on the account of Bryan with recommendations that made our evening timeless. I work in customer service and have to say something when I see it correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow-- a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: punkinpie11
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a colleague for business-- and when the company is paying, I usually stay at the Intercontinental (just up the street), but with 2 people, 2 cars to park, and a weeklong stay, having the HIX experience seemed to be better all around. (For those not familiar, HIX has free wi-fi, free breakfasts, and-- in this case-- valet parking for 15 a day with in-and-outs. All stuff you'd pay heavily for at the ICH.) I saw the pictures of the queen loft suite, and it seemed too weird to pass up, so I booked 2 of them. We had suites 403 and 415. 415 was bigger, but not by much, and the view was not worth the extra 10 bucks a nite. Both had a ridiculous amount of room-- a full sitting area on the first level, which made it very easy to have meetings. (Of course, I as a parent, I was thinking it would be awesome with kids, plenty of room to move, and separate sleeping area-- not something you get in a trad room.) The spiral staircase led up to a queen bed placed in a serene, blue-painted space, with another huge TV. Some nuts and bolts for the power readers: There is a Ralphs grocery store directly across the street, which has a good stock of small sized items that work well for a short stay. It's on Olympic, the easier way to get across town (than doing Santa Monica Blvd.) As someone else noted, valet parking is super-fast. Breakfast had a good variety but is crammed into a tiny space. There was some work happening in the space-- it might be newly renovated/constructed?-- but nothing bothersome. As much as I love the luxe of the Intercontinental, we'll be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: InterestedTravler
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business and this hotel was the most convienent for me. I was very impressed by the staff, my room and the continental breakfast. They have a great variety of breakfast options and keep the breakfast area clean and stocked. I also slept great and had a very nice big bathroom. The only negative was that the elevator was very slow, so i always had to wait for the elevator, no matter what time of day. I was impressed by how quick the valet was able to bring my car around each morning, i never waited more than 2-3 minutes. It is also so convienent to the Century City mall that has great eating options and great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to get a state employee rate”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLeslie
Reviews.Content: I searched the Beverly Hills area to get a state employee rate because I had to go there for business. Holiday Inn Express on Olympic Blvd was the only place I could find. Upon arrival, the front desk people were warm and welcoming, commenting on my great rate. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed was great and everything worked. The lcoation was perfect for my needs. I wouls easily return when I am in the area. Breakfast was offered with the room, but I chose to go to Nate 'n Al's, my favorite breakfast place in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Its just OK”
Reviews.Author: pkil
Reviews.Content: Cheap Hotel at a good location amateur staff decent enough to stay for a day or two breakfast was good Clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “One of the best little hotels I've ever stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaMu
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel, great location, WONDERFUL staff...enormous room. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: Aly0808
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was not a great one, on entering the second floor corridor there was a very unpleasant smell, quite musty, reminding me of a damp old soiled carpet, and my instinct was to turn and run. I was, however too tired and desperate for sleep. I am pleased to say that the smell was not permanent, but the was still an occasional unpleasant odor. This is noticeable when exiting the elevator which is next to the stairs so perhaps this is where the smell is coming from.... Perhaps people smoking in the car park or other smells coming from there? I am glad that I did stay. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful, the bed was comfortable, with a choice of pillow softness, the shower was hot and refreshing. My room was a very good size. The location is fantastic... Just across the road from Century City, 2 close supermarkets to stock your fridge if you wish. Close to the farmers market at Fairfax and 3rd for great fruit and vegetables. 5 minutes from the Beverly Hills shopping areas. Not too far from the beaches, Hollywood or downtown. Easy access to public transport. My only negatives (once the smell dissipated) are the tacky fake flowers everywhere, especially the single white ones which have dusty and discoloured gel, making it look moldy - use fresh flowers or don't bother. Also the extreme waste of supplies and the cost to the environment, my 2 soaps were thrown away and replaced every day, and the toilet paper was changed way before required several times when I was here, even though there is a second roll in the bathroom in case you run out - save the environment and please only replace supplies as required. I would stay here again, loved the location, some really good staff members (Troy, Michael, Gloria and Sophia were all personally helpful to me), and the price was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bgnHI
Reviews.Content: First time I stayed at this hotel or a Holiday Express. Location was perfect for my business. Bryan at the Front Desk was extremely helpful in helping me find a local Sprint Store among other things. He went over and above what I expected. Staff here is very helpful. Easy access in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Crwydrgi
Reviews.Content: A mix-up over the booking (but probably not the fault of the hotel) wasn’t the best of starts for a group of jet-lagged travelers, but the concierge was professional and helpful, and with a bit of give-and-take we got things sorted out. By LA standards this hotel is probably in the budget class, but we found it to be professionally and efficiently run, offering all the amenities we needed (eg TV, wi-fi, fridge, microwave, coffee-maker, hairdryer), in clean and comfortable rooms. The breakfasts were self-served, and more than adequate though lacking much variation. Breakfast seating was quite limited but we never actually failed to get a table, and trays were available to carry back to the room if required. All the members of staff we met were friendly and helpful. Not much to occupy a tourist in the immediate locality (unless you count the fine shopping mall on the next block) but I guess most visitors to LA would have use of a vehicle and take advantage of the hotel’s valet parking and the convenient accessibility on Olympic Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amerikaan314
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HEX Century City last Thanksgiving! It was a very quiet and nice budget hotel. Attentive and friendly staff. They answered all of our silly touristy questions with a smile. Large spacious room. Clean bathroom. Outstanding location - close to everything. Valet parking downstairs was convenient and an added safety factor. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again when in the LA area...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent lication”
Reviews.Author: mjm19
Reviews.Content: Interesting 2 story rooms, recently renovated Beattie heart of century city and close to major attractions. Friendly staff, easy checkin. 10 min to century city mall

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Holiday Inn Century City”
Reviews.Author: NoukyMontreal
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel with our young child. We came to visit L.A. and attractions around. We liked the hotel, we had a big room on the 4th floor with a mezzanine, which was very useful having a child with us. It was like having 2 rooms. The room was comfortable, quiet, clean, there was a nice bathroom and 2 televisions. Micro-wave and fridge, free and easy internet access (wi fi) were available. The breakfast buffet was very good and there was a lot of choices. What we did not like: - parking costs $10 (including valet service) per day - the dock to recharge iPod/iPhone was broken, couldn't insert my iPod in it - breakfast room is very small and vending machines has little choices. Otherwise, it's a very good place to stay and I would recommend this hotel. You should have a car because you need it if you want to go around,

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, but nothing worth walking to except for the mall.”
Reviews.Author: SassyTravelerDC
Reviews.Content: Century City is in a central location, but you need a car to get to anything. There isn't anything to see but the mall. Best thing about the mall is the food court and it's very new and clean. Nothing else in the immediate area. Quiet area. Ralph's Grocery Store across the street. Not alot of hotels in the area and most are expensive because Beverly Hills is close by but not within walking distance. Limited parking. Valet with in and out privileges is $15/night. Very very basic hotel. Valet is also bellboy, front desk, and runs extra housekeeping items to rooms. Hotel is very very small. Room was not what we expected or had reserved. There is a frig and microwave in every room. We were there over a holiday and the front desk had overbooked and were calling people the day of to cancel their reservations. We asked for extra towels and got 1 towel. The next day we did not have all the towels we should have. We ended up buying our own. Top floor is all rooms with lofts. There is a padded spiral staircase to the loft area. 2 flatscreens for the loft rooms. Very small bathroom and closets. Breakfast is in Room 201. Pretty good spread. Price even on a non-holiday night isn't great. I would drive an extra 15 minutes or more and stay somewhere better or that's better priced. Would not recommend loft rooms for more than 2 adults or 2 adults and a kid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location..”
Reviews.Author: Bikram_Sheen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Sept '10 and this hotel was just what I was looking for. Great location (there's a Ralph's right across the street that has a great beer selection), friendly staff (they told me about the beer selection), and the greatest thing was the A/C worked killer in the room. It was like I had my personal little igloo. Another great aspect of this hotel is that it has a loft so the bed is located upstairs with it's own t.v; great for that nagging wife who wants to watch some cooking show while I watch the Bruins play downstairs. Great hotel, great rates, great staff. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Cheers, mate.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE IN VERY GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MikeTObaby
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for value in a very good location then look no place else. Thia hotel served breakfast every morning and did it just right. The valet I think was the cheapest in the area too. We had a loft suite which essentially means two suites in 1. This was awesome! it gave us our own private corners to do whatever with. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: BooTerp02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in June 2010 while in L.A. This hotel is what it is.....a clean hotel, decent location, and good value. It's not within walking distance of much as it is sort of a residential area, but we drove quite easily to Santa Monica, Malibu, Hollywood, and downtown on weekdays and didn't find traffic and distance to be all that bad. Great free breakfast, and very helpful, caring staff. Only drawbacks are parking is valet and $15 or so and the traffic on Olympic Blvd. was hard to fall asleep to. I had to turn the air on in the room so the fan would drown out the noise from the street. Might want to ask for a room on the side of the hotel away from the street. I do recommend this hotel for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Warning!! Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: TEEZ_R_US
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent, and I had booked this hotel for some clients of mine that wanted to stay in the area. It all looked good from what I reviewed on this site. I reserved for 4 nights origionally. I had cancelled this hotel well in advance as my clients decided to stay in Anaheim instead. I even received a cancellation number. My clients came back from the trip and had TWO charges from this hotel on their credit card. I called the hotel, spoke to the front desk which were rude to begin with. I asked to speak with the manager, they transfered me to a general staff answering machine, instead of telling me he's not in his office. It took forever for me to get a hold of the manager as he "had no direct line" to get a hold of ...leaving messages, and finally I insisted on calling back until I got a hold of him directly. He was very rude and wouldn't even listen to anything I had to say before he assumed it was my fault in the cancellation, saying he does not have a cancellation number on file. He also said that the booking was checking in for 2 nights, then checking back in on the check out date for another 2 nights. Doesn't that seem a bit fishy to you when I only made one reservation? And why would I do that in the first place?! I even got my manager who has been in the travel industry for many years to talk to him. He still denied it, saying it was our fault and would only drop one of the charges out of "good will". The client is better off the deny ANY charges from this place from her credit card company (just a little tip if this happens to any of you...) Moral of the story...if you book this place, make sure you're staying for the full duration or they might screw you over as well. As a travel agent for a huge, well known company (AAA/CAA), I will never recommend anyone to stay here, unless they like to deal with rude staff who does nothing for you when things go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whizey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. The room was clean but nothing special about it at all. You had to pay to park, no one was at the front desk when I wanted to check out. It's not walking distance to anything of importance. You can walk to the mall but it's a long walk. All in all it's an ok place. Nothing great but nothing all that bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating hotel in a great area!!!”
Reviews.Author: thetruth2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the LA area to visit my dad and wanted to stay in a nice area with a comfortable room. We decided on this hotel because of the location and I was not disappointed. The hotel is located a few minutes away from ritzy Beverly Hills and West Hollywood. Perfect for sight-seeing and being close to all of the action. The hotel was small but quaint and very accomodating as well. It is located on a fairly busy road so I would suggest a room not facing the street if you are sensitive to street noises. There was also valet parking which cost $15 a day (required to pay) but that's pretty normal for that area so it wasn't too big of a deal. The FREE continental breakfast ecery morning was great:-) We had a wonderful stay and I would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Wearytraveller_9
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is small but friendly. Free breakfast was good, Room was OK, but had to move from first room as A/C broken. Parking was Valet only as cars had to be parked in front or each other in small parking garage and expensive, but only other option was limited parking outside hotel in street.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great value”
Reviews.Author: bruisedlee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location for us who were on an arts & culture weekend trip in LA. After spending a whole Saturday taking in the sights and sounds of Hollywood and the Getty Center, we were glad to have made a good choice in accommodations. The room itself was wonderful and served its purpose of providing us with a restful night's sleep. We had two really comfortable queen beds, a big flatscreen TV with cable, a mini fridge, a microwave and a coffeemaker. The a/c was fantastic - it cooled up the room in no time. One of the minor issues I had though was that the bathroom door didn't have a lock and the shower curtain was ripped at the top. Other than that, everything was fine. Perhaps the best part was having free breakfast in the morning. Biscuits and gravy, bacon and eggs, cinnamon rolls, danish, and other breakfast pastries, cereals, and all beverages were provided. I thought that was enough to start the day right. I just wish that parking was included, but I guess the $15 valet fee provides some security to the hotel and its guests...Also, prepare for a really small elevator ; ) After checking out, we drove up to Malibu to the beautiful Getty Villa, which was less than a half hour drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kuper
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Holiday Inn was with teenagers looking at colleges and seeing Los Angeles. The hotel was great. Our room had a loft and my girls loved it. It was centrally located and easily accessible for UCLA and The Grove. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tkamb
Reviews.Content: Century City is a great option if you're traveling by car and looking for a hotel as a center of your trips exploring the Los Angeles area. Holiday Inn Express Century City is on a busy boulevard that will take you quite conveniently to most of the highways or neighborhoods (e.g. Beverly Hills) that you might be interested in. Though W. Olympic Blvd is pretty busy, our room wasn't too noisy to sleep in. Air conditioning worked perfectly. The hotel and our room was very clean and comfortable. We had free wi-fi, a huge flat screen TV, fridge, coffee maker with free coffee. No restaurant in the hotel but you can order take away as room service from a restaurant nearby. Breakfast is complimentary, included yogurt, milk, cereals, eggs, pastry (bagel, muffin, toast) and cinnamon rolls. Valet parking is the only option for 15 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: audreysg
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is clean and bath room is well maintained. The staff are friendly and gave us lots of information sightseeing and car rental during our stay. Although the room is equiped with free broadbrand internet, we were allowed to use the computer in staff's office at our leisure. I could also use the hotel printer to print several emergency documents. Room facing the main road could noisy. So try to avoid those rooms when you checkin. The location is convenient enough for my stay since I am attending a conference at Hyatt hotel nearby. There is a supermarket right opposite the hotel. The shopping mall with a cinema is within 15 mins by foot or 5 mins by car.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Albymorkel
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as a base to look around L.A. It is near major attractions and a shopping complex with restaurants is only about a 5 minute walk away. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious, the only drawback was a noisy air conditioner that was a bit annoying. The staff were friendly and provided information when asked. The breakfast was included however it is a no frills affair and if you are staying there for more than a couple of days i would recommend trying to find a nearby cafe/restaurant. Overall a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Unique, great all around”
Reviews.Author: Melmo5
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel highly because it had everything we were looking for on our stay in Los Angeles. I was apprehensive about staying in Hollywood (dirty) or Beverly Hills (expensive) or Santa Monica (crowded?) or some place just too modern for a family with kids. I want it all on a budget and am happy say that the Holiday Express delivers. This place doesn't look like much from the outside, and the front lobby is small, but everything else was great. Reasonable price, clean, comfortable, quiet room, central location in a nice neighborhood, nice touches/ammenities like a huge flat screen tv in the main living area, super comfortable beds with firm and soft pillows so you have a choice, and a better than average continental breakfast. For a family of 5, this room was awesome with a queen bed and smaller flat screen tv upstairs, and a very cool two story main living area. The bathroom was spacious with gleaming black granite tile and plush towels. My teenage boys even noticed that the shampoo and soap "smelled good" like cinnamon, which is really saying something. Coffee, fridge, and microwave in room - no pool that we could find, but who needs one when you can head for the beach. Looking forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: AZN305
Reviews.Content: I'll just get to the point: I wouldn't stay here again. I only stayed here for convenience purposes because I was attending the UCLA graduation. I probably should have done more research on this hotel, or at least read more reviews about what people's opinions and thoughts were. The one circumstance I disliked the most was the valet parking, I think that for this location valet was not necessary, it's just an excuse to drain more money from their customers. The other things I disliked were the air conditioners, they were quite noisy and didn't work properly, also the closet on the loft area of our suite didn't open all the way thus it was rendered useless during our stay at this hotel. Some positive things about our stay were the friendly customer service when we checked in, and the room, I have to admit, was clean and aside from the closet and the A/C, everything else worked like it was supposed to. I suppose if you're desperate OR the location is appealing (which it is) to you then do book a room here, otherwise if you can afford something else look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: trickito
Reviews.Content: very clean, very nice hotel. the service was impeccable and the location is good too. was shocked (in a good way) to see that my room was a corner unit with a sleeping loft & spiral staircase. loved the room. i booked directly on H. Inn website and had signed up for H. Inn frequent "flier" account, maybe thats why. free wifi internet. the only knocks against this place are a slight bit of traffic noise from olympic blvd, but it's not so loud as to be disruptive. and the mediocre (albeit free) breakfast in their common room, rotten milk, yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean and Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: beefydoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on vacation with my family and would recommend it as a nice , clean moderately priced option while in LA. The staff was very nice and accommodating. It seems to be a fairly new hotel so it is clean and surprisingly quiet for being on such a busy boulevard. As a rule I like the Holiday Inn Express chain for their price point and free breakfast when I am traveling with my family. This hotel is certainly as nice and clean as any other Holiday Inn Express I have stayed in. The lobby is a little cramped, but we were given a spacious corner room because of our 3 kids. And we had plenty of room. Most of the west LA attractions ( Sunset Strip, movie studios, Santa Monica Pier, Beverly Hills, Hollywood Bowl) are within a 30 minute drive. Not a bad location in sprawling LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room/ Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: explorer1421
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Close to UCLA. The room was big and comfortable- very clean. Staff was friendly. Checked in late- parking wasn't a problem, but there is a $10.00 a night fee.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job nicely”
Reviews.Author: PhantomHotelReviewer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 4 nights in December 2007, redeeming some points to pay for the room. There was a special offer on the points which meant it was 3 nights for the usual points as 1, so staying here was a no-brainer. The hotel itself is on West Olympic Boulevard, which seemed to be a reasonable area to my untrained tourist eyes. There is valet only parking which was mandatory if you had a car. The hotel is quite small, around 50 rooms or so. We had a room on the 3rd floor which was a large room with king size bed. There was a huge LCD TV and good air conditioning. The bathroom was quite large and very clean with good toiletries and towels. The bath was a standard one but had a jacuzzi setting which was quite nice. The complimentary breakfast was very welcome - as a previous reviewer mentioned, the lady who looks after the breakfast room is very friendly and helpful. She practically insisted we take some fruit and pastries for our trip that day. Other good points are that there is a grocery store opposite if you need food to put in the fridge or to cook in the microwave. Also, there are some restaurants that will deliver food to the hotel. I can recommend the Indian restaurant that delivers, very highly. The only things I didn't really like were the fact that the doors closed very noisly if left to slam shut and the elevator was very slow. I think also the valet parking concept just doesn't appeal to me.

Reviews.Title: “Best in its Class”
Reviews.Author: elnap29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. We chose it because it was within walking distance of family we were visiting, and because my husband had stayed there once before. Our standard room with king bed was extremely comfortable and clean. The bed was terrific and we slept well. Although Olympic Blvd. is a busy street, the traffic was minimal late at night and Saturday and Sunday mornings; we even slept with a window open and the room was quiet. The staff was welcoming and friendly but not intrusive. The woman who tended the breakfast room was friendly and made sure everyone had plenty to eat. There were ample choices including oatmeal, yogurt, cereals, bagels, toast, juices, hot cinnamon rolls, eggs, sausages, etc. The room had a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, bottled water, plasma tv, and hair dryer. Location was convenient with easy access to the freeways, Santa Monica, Beverly Hills, etc. So far, this is our preferred choice of West LA hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at HI Express Century City”
Reviews.Author: traveladventurer_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property over the weekend. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The room accommodations were more than what we expected. The beds were very comfortable. The sheets were nice quality. Towels fluffy and new. I'm very pickey about these things. And the property is very clean. The room comes with complimentary breakfast. They have a lady named Marina who was overseeing the breakfast area. She made us feel very welcome and really took care of us. She made our stay very enjoyable. Highly recommend this property for business trips or family holidays. Great location.!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sista_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and located very close to Universal Studios. The breakfast food was very good and always fresh. The rates were incredibly reaosnable for a htoel so close to the major attractions. Parking was easy to find, covered and not expensive. The room had everything we needed and was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: ugobananas
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised at how nice this hotel was - there were four of us staying in the room for a tournament event at Fox Studios. We got a standard room with 2 queen beds and expected the standard hotel layout, but were pleasantly surprised to find that one of the beds was in a loft, and had it's own tv, phone, alarm clock, and small closet space. The bedding was much nicer than expected for a Holiday Inn - apparently their bedding, toiletries, etc. have all been recently upgraded - and they are very nice. We had soft sheets, 2 pillows each (firm or soft), a down comforter, and an extra blanket. The room was VERY spacious for a hotel room - there was plenty of room for a cot so two of the guys there wouldn't have to share a bed. We also had a mini-fridge and microwave in the room. We had friends staying nearby at the Intercontinental and said our room was much nicer than theirs and they were paying $20 more per night. The breakfast bar was great - fresh cinnamon rolls, lots of choices for beverages, cereals, fruits, and much more. The staff were wonderful - very helpful and friendly, never hesitated to go out of their way. They even let us check out two hours late without charging us - i tried this once at another hotel and they refused to let us extend our stay without paying extra. All-in-all we had a pleasant stay - not a 5-star resort of course, but if you need a nice place to stay in Century City I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: libie2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference at a nearby location. It was okay, a mixture of plus and minus points. I was upgraded to a two-level "suite" because the hotel was full, which was nice, but did involve going up and down stairs between the bedroom area and the bathroom. The room overlooked the street, and was pretty noisy, as was the air conditioning / heating system. This last was controlled within the room, and was quick and accurate, though. The hotel is opposite a grocery store, which was convenient, but I didn't feel safe walking alone between nearby locations at night so had to take cabs. (A friend of mine was not bothered by this.) There was a complimentary breakfast which was very pleasant and extensive for this kind of hotel - it included hot oatmeal, bagels, toast, cinnamon rolls, a variety of cereals, juices, fruit and coffee. Service was unpredictable: the first day I got a very friendly welcome and extra blankets arrived at my room within minutes. The second night however I was treated extremely rudely by another employee who refused to provide government tax forms (which were then supplied easily by another employee the next morning). Also, the air conditioner placed over the head of the bed was faulty and started dripping in the middle of the night... like the rest of the room is seemed very dated and old. For the price and convenience it was okay for this business trip, but I wouldn't stay here for pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Urgh. Dreadful.”
Reviews.Author: AreAnyNamesNotTaken
Reviews.Content: Normally, I wouldn't bother to review a Holiday Inn, because you pretty much know what to expect, but this place was so much worse than I had anticipated. Obviously, you don't expect much from Holiday Inn. They offer basic accommodation at a low price, and usually do so reasonably competently, as long as you're not staying for too long. I only chose Holiday Inn because I was only going to be in LA for one night, and because my priority was to be as close as possible to a specific Century City address, as I am unfamiliar with the city. But this place really failed to live up to Holiday Inn's usual standards. Whether you consider their usual standards to be adequate or not is besides the point - even a true Holiday Inn devotee would struggle to find this sty acceptable. Everything in the building (carpets, furniture, appliances, decor) was at least 30 years old, or had been horribly mistreated in order to give that impression. Nothing was particularly clean and it was all depressingly drab. Front desk staff were genuinely struggling to understand me (whether it was the English language or simply my English accent that caused the problem, I don't know, but if I were foolish enough ever to return, I would come armed with a Spanish phrasebook) and they also managed to lose the suitcase that I left in reception (although it did eventually turn up). The food and furniture that I found in the squalid breakfast room depressed me beyond belief. I have given 2 stars rather than one to take into account the low price and my already low expectations, and to reflect my grudging admission that it propbably could have been worse (at least the TV worked and the water was hot).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. My fiance and I stayed there from June 1st - 4th, 2006. Its a small hotel with only 45 rooms. There weren't many people in the hotel so they bumped us to a suite. They said it was a newer room and it was adequete as far as furnishment went. The parking is valet, so the staff is keeping an eye on your car for you. The breakfast is good and there is a Ralph's (large grocery store chain) right across the street. The rooms are clean. Its easy to get to the highway from the hotel. The staff is nice. Most of all as far as rates go, this hotel if fairly inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights for business. Staff were friendly. Room clean, large. No complaiints. Added benefit supermarket across the road!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management and Unprofessional Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Skylar_B
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at this hotel for a room with a handicap accessible shower. Our handicap accessible room was not available when we arrived, supposedly due to a stopped up drain. Our reservations had been made several days in advance, and our cell phone number was available to this staff. The room was guaranteed by credit card. No one advised us in advance that we would have NO ROOM when we arrived at our expected 10 pm arrival! When we arrived, we were told we would have to accept a room with NO accessibility. Of course, we asked why no one had informed us prior to our arrival so we could have found other accommodations. We were told no one thought it mattered since most people don't really need these rooms! We had to search the city at 10 pm at night for other accommodations after traveling all afternoon and evening! Totally unprofessional management!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: CLK14
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 of our 5 nights in Beverly Hills at this hotel. Decided to scrimp for 2 nights in order to spend more for an upscale hotel for the remaining 3. We chose this hotel because of location (good) and because of the reviews on this website (clean & friendly). Staff was very friendly. Free rolls & coffee in the lobby for breakfast. Valet indoor parking right outside the lobby door. As stated in other reviews, this hotel is very small, but the room was quite comfortable for 2 people. Bathroom was also average for a hotel, but was getting a little rundown. Likewise, the decor of room could be updated. Our air conditioning unit dripped water onto the carpet during the night, we discovered, but it wasn't a major annoyance. We did mention it to staff, but it was still dripping later in the day so I guess it wasn't anything serious. All in all, the best thing about hotel was the cleanliness and the friendliness. We probably wouldn't stay here again, but if you're on a budget it would be just fine & I think you'd be happy. We were only in the room for sleeping, so no real complaints. As a gauge to what I'm comparing this hotel to, we most often stay at Westins, Marriotts, or Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy with a great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip out west.... After rolling into LAX late on a Friday, getting our rental car late, and driving thru rush hour traffic (by our standards) at night, my family needed a place to lay our sleepy heads in peace and quiet. This place hit the spot. HIExpress Century City is convenient to Hollywood/Beverly Hills and all the sites there. The room was super clean and very quiet. The Continental breakfast was excellent and very filling. Try those wonderful HOT cinnamon rolls... I had 2. The staff are delightful and very happy to please. You have to pay for parking but it is valet and is also covered. Parking looks to be at a premium in that area so I was happy to pay it. The rates are so reasonable for LA that you won't even notice. There really isn' t much within walking distance so eat and grab your supplies closer to the main highways before arriving. My final evaluation... stay here if you can. It was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convienently located between Santa Monica and Beverly Hills, and a short drive from Hollywood and other tourist destinations. The hotel lobby was small, but the generous rooms made up for this. The hotel boasts about their jacuzzi tubs, but I wouldn't go expecting anything but an old (and small) size tub with a few jets. Beds were comfortable and the staff was relatively attentive. Parking was cheap by LA standards, and there is a grocery store across the street. Other than the grocery, there isn't anything else but a mall within walking distance. You'll definately need a car. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Its a great value and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Small but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an awesome, hassle-experience. VERY friendly, competent, professional staff with ZERO attitude. It had a bit of a homey, family feeling to it actually. The place was quiet and I was right next to the elevator but never heard it or anyone in the hallways. There was traffic noise however from the main street the hotel is located on. My corner room was small but very clean and the decor and furniture were nice and modern. In-room high-speed internet was a snap to set up, just plug in the cord and you're off surfing for free! I overslept the first day so I missed the complimentary continental breakfast which ends at 10 a.m. but the staff said "Just call down to the front desk tomorrow morning and we'll send you up whatever you like." The hotel itself is not located in a pedestrian-friendly area ... since there are no cafes, shops or places to hang near it -but there is a large supermarket right across the street if you're in a pinch for food but don't feel like driving. (There is not an onsite restaurant but the room had a fridge.) I guess what I liked most about the place is the small size of the lobby. It gave a cozy feeling to the place. It's a chain hotel but they fantastically put the EXPRESS in Holiday Inn Express. I will be back!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Century City
HotelInfo.Address: 10330 W. Olympic Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90064
